intro: Pimpinella betsileensis, commonly known as the Betsilean cowparsley, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to the unique ecological conditions of Socotra. Its limited distribution and specialized habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists studying endemic species.
